intro: Codonoboea hirta, commonly known as the hairy codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
